programme.title: The Encore Hour
programme.desc: A look at some of the drama programmes coming up on the channel this month.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Hazel Bellamy is daunted by a social invitation to spend the weekend at Somerby Park where she falls victim to a cruel prank. James's belief that she brought about her own downfall leads to her packing her bags and returning to London.(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A woman hires Holmes and Watson to investigate the strange death of her sister, whose enigmatic final words seemingly hold the key to the case. Period drama, starring Jeremy Brett and David Burke.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick tackles a tidy burglar who insists on clearing up the houses he robs, and investigates a suspicious church organist. Starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew secures a patient's life-saving operation, but Kirsty is still left wondering if she's doing the right thing. Medical drama about a rural Derbyshire practice.(n)

programme.title: Brideshead Revisited
programme.desc: Lord Marchmain returns to Brideshead with his mistress Cara, who tells everyone he has come home to die. A family feud breaks out about the fate of his soul, and Julie summons a priest in the hopes of reconciling the old man with the Church.(n)

programme.title: Noah's Ark
programme.desc: The discovery of two infected lemurs leads Noah to suspect a deadly epidemic could be about to hit Melton, but he still manages to find time to track down the crooked dealer who sold a seriously ill horse to a youngster. Meanwhile, a couple of newcomers to the area need urgent help with some pot-bellied pigs. Rural veterinary drama, starring Anton Rodgers and Angela Thorne.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A CND rally at the Early Warning Installation creates chaos in Aidensfield, causing Nick to fall out with Kate and an MP to be blackmailed. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Richard's mother-in-law visits Eaton Place for Christmas with her grand-daughter Georgina, who causes panic in the household by disappearing to the East End with the maid.(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A valuable gem is stolen from the Countess of Morcar, leading the famous detective into a bizarre investigation involving a recovered Christmas goose. Mystery, starring Jeremy Brett, David Burke and Ken Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Adventure of the Cheap Flat
programme.desc: An FBI agent crosses swords with Poirot while trying to retrieve the American Navy's top-secret plans for a new submarine, which have been stolen by a glamorous nightclub singer with a sideline in espionage. Drama, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is called in to investigate when the UK's prime minister and his secretary are kidnapped in France. However, he has only a day and a half to solve the case before an important conference is set to take place. Drama, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Mr Selfridge
programme.desc: Agnes works through the night to get the empire exhibition ready, but by morning it becomes clear to Harry she is struggling to cope with the project. Loxley pays Mr Selfridge a visit to tell him he can get Winston Churchill himself to open the event, while Lady Mae discovers the dire state of her husband's finances during a trip to the bank. Mr Grove is handed his final warning when he turns up to work late again, Henri receives a job offer and Rose finds Gordon's collection of racy photos.(n)

programme.title: Jordskott
programme.desc: Eva finds a strange bottle left behind at her father's house and then discovers a tunnel leading from the forest up to the door. Meanwhile, the murderer is on the hunt for new victims - but Wass keeps hiding all signs of non-human activity. Swedish thriller, starring Moa Gammel.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: As the crime drama returns for a fourth series, a vulnerable young man is reported missing by his pub landlord boss. Syndicate 9 suspect Robin McKendrick may have been killed after a photo of him bound and gagged in a car boot appears online. However, the case takes an unusual turn when a body found in a flooded quarry turns out to be a woman's corpse. Meanwhile, battle-scarred from their conflict last year, Scott and Bailey are determined to move forward with honesty. The pair find themselves in front of the promotion board and pass with flying colours, leaving Gill with the task of choosing who stays on as sergeant at the department. Danny Webb joins a cast led by Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Chandler's team begins to accept his methods, but struggles to find any real leads. As Buchan becomes closer to the investigation, his knowledge of Jack the Ripper's crimes helps the officers to identify a suspect - but an attempt to catch him in the act goes terribly wrong. Thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton.(n)

programme.title: Mr Selfridge
programme.desc: Agnes works through the night to get the empire exhibition ready, but by morning it becomes clear to Harry she is struggling to cope with the project. Loxley pays Mr Selfridge a visit to tell him he can get Winston Churchill himself to open the event, while Lady Mae discovers the dire state of her husband's finances during a trip to the bank. Mr Grove is handed his final warning when he turns up to work late again, Henri receives a job offer and Rose finds Gordon's collection of racy photos.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: DI Jane Preston and DS Ben Shaw are called to investigate the theft of £2,000 from an 80-year-old woman's home. Initially, suspicion falls on a possible rogue trader who visited the house to fix the roof, but a chance remark by the victim's flirtatious daughter Sylvia prompts the duo to wonder whether the culprit might be closer than they think. Drama, guest starring Deena Payne (Emmerdale), Stuart Organ (The Bill) and Kazia Pelka (Heartbeat).(n)

programme.desc: Tom and Clare make an unexpected discovery while searching for a missing badger cub, and Noah's reputation is dealt a severe blow by the death of a valuable prize cow. Veterinary drama, featuring an early screen appearance by comedian Jack Whitehall and starring Anton Rodgers and Angela Thorne.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Village life is disrupted by a circus family who are accused of corrupting the vicar's daughter, wrecking the shop and breaking into the church. Meanwhile, Nick and Kate are attacked for resisting local bigots. Eleanor Bron guest stars, with Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Adventure of the Western Star
programme.desc: A Belgian film star arrives in London and summons her friend Poirot to unravel the mysterious threats she has been receiving, which demand the return of a priceless diamond, the Western Star. Rosalind Bennett guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls victim to depression after failing to prevent the murder of a society girl by notorious art thief Marrascaud. His confidence shattered, Poirot eventually returns to work when a lonely chauffeur begs him to find his missing soulmate, the maid of a famous Russian dancer. The investigation takes him to the Swiss Alps, where, against all odds, he stumbles upon a hotel thought to be Marrascaud's hideout - leading to a very personal showdown. The penultimate episode of the long-running detective drama, starring David Suchet, with Simon Callow, Orla Brady, Patrick Ryecart, Nigel Lindsay, Morven Christie, Tom Austen and Rupert Evans.(n)

programme.title: Jordskott

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Syndicate 9 find themselves dealing with a high-profile historical case after Mandy Sweeting's body is recovered from a quarry, 23 years after she was first reported missing. However, Rachel's biggest challenge might not be dealing with the media attention or even re-interviewing bereft family members, but hiding her contempt for Rob Waddington's father Frankie (former Coronation Street star Ian Mercer), who led the original investigation. Meanwhile, Janet also has problems to deal with at home, as Elise moves in with her dad and his new girlfriend. But at least it inspires the detective to look at her own love life, as she confides in Rachel that she's started using dating sites. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp and Danny Miller.(n)

programme.desc: Sheldon invites a famous physicist to the flat after befriending her online, but is put out to find Leonard showing an interest in her. Meanwhile, Penny has to confront her ex-boyfriend when the visitor turns up in his bedroom. Guest starring Judy Greer (Glenn Martin, DDS).(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler and Ross face two bullies at Central Perk. Monica decides to have a flutter on the stock market and Phoebe meets a long-lost family member. Comedy, guest starring Giovanni Ribisi (Avatar).(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio of motoring enthusiasts embark on another epic road trip, this time across western America in front-engined supercars. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for the latest incarnation of Aston Martin's Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and there's a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac drummer Mick Fleetwood rolls up his sleeves to thrash the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Sara and Greg are quarantined after responding to a murder when they fear the crime scene may be contaminated with a lethal virus. The team discovers the victim had been exposed to Ibare, which causes internal haemorrhaging and carries an 80 per cent fatality rate. As the killer is most likely infected, the CSIs must race to find the culprit before an outbreak occurs, and they consult with Dr Heather Lanning of the Centres for Disease Control and Prevention. Guest starring Lauren Stamile (Grey's Anatomy).(n)

programme.title: The Notorious
programme.desc: Documentary following mixed martial artist Conor McGregor as he prepares for further successes in his sport. In the first programme, Conor recovers from a knee injury sustained in his win against Max Holloway and undergoes gruelling physiotherapy and training to ready himself for his fight against Brazilian challenger Diego Brandao.(n)

programme.title: The Notorious
programme.desc: Conor McGregor moves a step closer to a shot at UFC Featherweight Championship holder Jose Aldo following his first round knockout of Diego Brandao in Dublin. With a third victory under his belt, he travels to Las Vegas to negotiate a new contract with the UFC and films a promotional video in Los Angeles for his next fight.(n)

programme.title: Tyrant
programme.desc: Barry conspires to start a coup and remove his increasingly unpredictable and violent brother from office - but Jamal is feeling thankful to his sibling for helping with Sheik Rashid's demise, and decides to stop at nothing to prove his worth to him. Starring Adam Rayner, Ashraf Barhom and Jennifer Finningan.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Quiz show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.desc: Coverage of day nine at the All England Club, where the men's quarter-final matches are scheduled to take place in the third Grand slam tournament of the year. Andy Murray saw his reign as champion come to an end at this stage last year, as he suffered a 1-6, 6-7, 2-6 loss to Grigor Dimitrov.
